Reviews.Title: “A Great Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: Cathyc7
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at the Four Seasons on a business trip. We arrived before check in time. My friend's room was ready, mine was not. We decided to have lunch. It was quite a nice lunch, although the view of the Public Storage facility is not the best. During the lunch my key arrived and our bags were taken to the rooms and correctly put in each room. I had a very good room service breakfast, right on time. This has all the usual feel of a Four Serasons, including excellent service. I would happily stay there again. I had a view of the water, which is very interesting and I would recommend it. It can be so nice to just relax into a Four Seasons and know things will be done right!

Reviews.Title: “from beging to the end of our stay, a truly outstanding luxury and comfort hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tmurph99
Reviews.Content: An unscheduled layover Seattle with three cranky teens (trying to fly home after a long spring break trip to Whister BC) and the management couldn't have been more accomodating. Pilllow-toped rollaway beds in the two large king rooms were almost more luxurious than any single-sized bed in our our own home! Plus, welcoming snacks (organic local soda, salt n vinegar chips, and a large choc chip brownie), both revitalized and refreshed the gang (a much-appreciated plus for their father and I). The rooftop infinity edge outdoor heated pooled and hottube were a huge hit, and was a very relaxing and beautiful place from which to watch the setting sun over Elliot Bay. Ultra modern baths, with an extra deep soaking tubs, separate rainshower, and TV'd mirrors also transformed what could've been a disasterous ending of our trip to one of it's highlights. Conveniently located next door to the famouse Pike Place market - a wonderful fresh fish dinner at Etta's also made this unexpected detour a truly memorable experience. I would recommend to anyone familiar with Four Seasons quality not to miss this one!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: J_Y_F_C
Reviews.Content: I live in Vancouver, BC, Canada which is across the boarder from Seattle however I had to stay overnight for business meetings. I would highly recommend the Four Seasons Hotel. In one word this hotel is perfection. Literally there is nothing wrong with this hotel. I am very picky about the level of service I receive in hotel and there is not one think I could complain about this hotel is the BEST hotel I have ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: andyrout1
Reviews.Content: Was lucky enough to stay here for nearly two weeks and it is just the perfect place to stay. I fully agree with other reviewers - from front to back the service is top notch, no exception. Front desk, concierge, bar staff, doormen, room service, housekeeping - all worth mentioning as they were all exceptional. They really couldn't do enough! The practicalities are superb too - lovely spacious rooms, impeccably well designed and very quiet. Great bar and restaurant, well equipped gym, luxuriously decorated throughout, and the hotel is in a super location by the waterfront right smack in the centre of town. There really is no reason to stay anywhere else. Thanks to all at the hotel for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep well in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: VickyLondon
Reviews.Content: Just spent a weekend at the Four Seasons in Seattle. The room was wonderful and we were looked after expertly by everyone at the hotel. Great location too. We enjoyed the gym and spa facilities - the steam room was amazing. Everything at the hotel was well thought out. Highly recommend to anyone thinking of visiting.

Reviews.Title: “A ray of sunshine in rainy Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Deb I
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the best! The guest room was large, tastfully decorated, quiet, and comfortable. The front desk personnel, doormen and concierge could not have been more helpful, friendly or courteous. The hotel is also extremely well located, within a short walking distance to Pike's Market, the Art Museum, many fine restaurants, the waterfront, and other Seattle attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Layover Location -”
Reviews.Author: RC_KJ_Travels
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed two nights at the Four Seasons on our way to a two week vacation in Hawaii. We wanted to break up the long trip from Detroit to Honolulu by laying over in Seattle. The Four Seasons is in a great location downtown, near the waterfront. Every aspect of our stay was superb and it was a great start to an awesome vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Seattle”
Reviews.Content: I have been to Seattle many times and have stayed at many fine hotels however The Four Seasons Seattle trumps them all. The service by all the employees from bell staff, bar, front desk, spa, concierge desk, housekeeping, all of them are perfect professionals who aims to please all their customers. It is always worth staying at a Four Seasons Hotel anywhere in the world as they are all about first class service and making the customer feel special. Great rooms with great views of Seattle, perfect location very close to Pike's Market and shopping. Close to the convention centre for those of you staying here on business which was in my case for this trip. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to experience a stressfree, first class experience. Check out my profile on tripadvisor of the places I have stayed to realize that I know what I am talking about when it comes to first class hotels and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service and terrific views in a great location”
Reviews.Author: 263Travel
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel in a terrific location with breath taking views. Superb service and warm, clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Review”
Reviews.Author: Jason M
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Very conveniently located on a dead end street within walking distance to the waterfront. Big room, spacious bathroom with separate shower stall and toilet area. Good restaurant Art on the first floor. Hotel is new and well run and it shows. Excellent service. Must be the best hotel in Seattle. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A Travel Writer's Review - Top Quality, Great Location, Original Art”
Reviews.Author: TravelbyLori
Reviews.Content: In the lobby, BraytonHughes Design Studios used wood and stone to bring the majestic beauty of the Seattle area inside. The modern fireplace seems to always be lit. As the city can be rainy, I felt this feature added a warm ambiance to the room. The front desk staff was impeccably “Four Seasons.” If you have not stayed at a Four Season’s hotel before, you must just for the guest experience. Staff members are undoubtedly the most professionally gracious I have come across in my travels. While sitting in the lobby one day, I had more than one person (without knowledge that I am a travel writer) ask what they could help me with in such a way that I felt I was the most important guest in the hotel. LOCATION The hotel sits on a prime spot, honestly near everything. The famous Pike Place Market is a five minute walk away. Here you can watch the throwing of the fish, eat at the incredible Place Pigalle, shop for anything, and admire rows and rows of mammoth fresh flowers. The Four Seasons Seattle is also near five museums, making it ideal as a central point for those visiting for the bright art scene here. Of particular interest to me and my husband during our visit was the Experience Music Project/Science Fiction Museum and Hall of Fame. No doubt you’d recognize the bizarre multi-hued metal building. The exhibits inside actually rock. ROOMS The accommodations are designed in signature Four Seasons neutral tones, allowing the art to take center stage. The art and artists of this hotel are a expressly talented motley group, all originating from the Northwest. The art of Francis Celentano, Kenneth Callahan, Morris Graves, Carl and Hilda Morris, Ambrose Patterson, Mary Randlett and many more grace the private and main rooms of the hotel. SPA The spa décor, also designed by BraytonHughes, is a modern interpretation of the “natural elements of the Puget Sound.” Great care was taken to incorporate an organic serenity into the spa experience here. The spa beds are especially comfortable and use the softest bedding I’ve seen in a spa. DINING The head chef of ART Restaurant follows a Best Source philosophy by hand-picking ingredients from the Pike Place Market and other Seattle sources. The dishes are inspired by the Pacific Northwest and take pride in presenting an amazing array of the highest quality seafood choices available. The menu here tends to change in keeping with this philosophy, so a new favorite entrée is likely from visit to visit. MY RECOMMENDATION This is a beautiful hotel grounded in grace, service and culture. I recommend booking your stay now. My husband and I upload video reviews of the luxury hotels we visit at YouTube.com/TravelbyLori. Take a look. You can read more of my written reviews by searching "Lori Metze" at Examiner.com.

Reviews.Title: “Up to Four Seasons Standards and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: PhillyVoyager
Reviews.Content: I lucked out with a conference rate and was quite pleased, worth the extra walk to get to the convention center. The hotel is fairly new and definitely up to 4 seasons standards, similar to the one in Denver in decor. The room was quite large with a separate bedroom separated from a large bathroom by a small hallway-- I had a city view room but could see the harbor in a reflection on the building across the street. As is typical of 4 seasons, the staff really made the experience with everyone being very helpful and friendly, including providing a town car for trips around town when it was available. The hotel is 1 block from the Pike Place Market, 7 blocks from the convention center, and 3 blocks from the Westlake station that will take you to the Space Needle.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and central location + great service”
Reviews.Author: nodrama1
Reviews.Content: Very new and modern hotel so the rooms are in great shape. Breakfast was excellent and the service first class. Hotel looks at the bay over the highway though views are pretty good. I had a partial bay view looking over hotel pool - bay was hard to see. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: nevels2000
Reviews.Content: Typically, I stay in boutique hotels when I travel to Seattle. However, my wife and I decided to stay at the Four Seasons for a long weekend and it was perfect. We had a bay view room and it was just magnificent. The price was comparable to other hotels and the location was unbeatable. We never got around to the onsite restaurant but room service was very good. Ate breakfast while overlooking the bay.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Staff”
Reviews.Author: sunfun18
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons in Seattle is a beautiful hotel in a perfect location, but what sets it apart from other hotels is the magnificent staff. The front desk is very accommodating. The concierge arranged wonderful in room massages for us and provided excellent directions to our destinations. The wait staff at the Art restaurant even helped us plan our itinerary each day and gave us valuable insights as to great spots to visit that weren't as touristy such as the Fremont Market. Everyone is extremely nice and helpful. The hotel lobby is lovely and the rooms are serene. The bathroom is huge. We had a room on a high floor facing the city and it was very quiet. The beds are comfortable. The breakfasts are wonderful. I was very impressed and would return for future visits.

Reviews.Title: “First class, personal service”
Reviews.Author: justthefacts41
Reviews.Content: It was my pleasure to stay at the Seattle Four Season's for a stay-cation with my husband. I was impressed with their offering the hotel's personal car service when I inquired about a taxi and loved the room on the pool level facing Puget Sound. We were also thrilled with the service from our server and food for breakfast at the restaurant as well.

Reviews.Title: “Four Season Hotel top Notch Experience”
Reviews.Author: Carla H
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel with wonderful staff and many personalized and added touches to our stay! Our family of 4 was treated like royalty. Both of our daughters felt special and recognized. The personalized touches to our room for our daughters 13th birthday were special and most importantly you didn't leave our the 10 year old she felt equally as wonderful. The beds were fabulous our youngest even pulled up the sheets to figure out what kind of bed she slept on. The rain shower, tv in the mirror, and huge spa tub were enjoyed by all. Most importantly the customer service was fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an even better location”
Reviews.Author: dnadler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel that is right next to Pike street market. Rooms are very comfortable. The pool/jacuzzi setting is great considering you are in a busy downtown area. Be advised that the rooms don't photograph well, the pictures posted by travelers are not that great because of the room color/decor are somewhat plain, the rooms look much better in real life than the pictures show.

Reviews.Title: “Setting the gold standard for hotels”
Reviews.Author: darrenj
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at a Four Seasons when I was on a business trip. I had high expectations which were surpassed in every way. I was in a standard room which was huge. Amazingly comfortable beds, huge bathroom with a huge deep bath and a TV in the mirror, Customr service was exceptional in every way especially in the bar where the bar staff made exceptional cocktails. The Spa and Gym were top quality and well worth the money. Highly recommended if you can get to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “My overall experience was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: LovinMauiLahaina
Reviews.Content: You cannot go wrong when staying at a Four Seasons hotel. I also would recommend their late night happy hour at the Art restaurant/bar. Delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Over-The-Top Fantastic Service!”
Reviews.Author: Cindy B
Reviews.Content: This was my first opportunity to stay at a Four Seasons property and they definitely exceeded my expectation in every way possible. From the check-in, to bed turn down, to the food and drink in the bar and restaurant, I could not have asked for more. The Four Seasons over delivered in service each and every time I needed something, and even when I wasn't expecting it (like placing slippers next to the bed after turn down service). I will definitely be staying at this location in the future. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience.”
Reviews.Author: gramasharon
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect. When we checked in the girl at the front dest caught the names of the kids and called them by name the entire time we were there. The kids got special treats which made them happy! The hotel is close to everything so you don't need a car to get around.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic Hotel in a very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: rapito79
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Seattle for two nights, and this property it really is worth every penny, rooms are magnificent, very large and equipped with all modern technologies, good leisure facilities with Fitness center, Spa and outdoor pool. The location is amazing: just a block away from the Pike Market. great place to stay and discover Seattle

Reviews.Title: “Great service with a friendly attitude”
Reviews.Author: NinaMontreal
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed here for a short weekend getaway and we couldn't have been happier. The rooms were spacious, bathroom was big, clean and cozy. The staff from front desk to restaurant and bellboys were all very friendly, ready to help and polite. The hotel is within walking distance of the famous Pike place market, retail shopping and good restaurants. They also have a very handy complimantary car service. In short, if the rate is reasonable, there is no better high end lodging choice in Seattle !

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: Marifaci
Reviews.Content: Amazing beatiful hotel with the nicest view in town! very nice staff except for the concierge, who was not very helpful at all!! yummy breakfast in the restaurant with spectaculars views!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: riesenweber3131
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the four seasons seattle was our first time staying here and we were not disappointed. The location was very central for shopping, visiting the waterfront and pikes place market. The hotel staff was all fantastic, we had great service at the concierge, front desk, lounge, bell desk, and restaurant. The staff was great at remembering us and greeting us warmly. The rooms were well designed and spacious, but very simple. Bathroom was large with a wonderful shower and bath area. Anything this hotel lacks they make up with the incredible staff. We did not encounter one rude staff member while we were there. Definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Town”
Reviews.Author: bill H
Reviews.Content: I have been visiting Seattle several times a year for over 25 years and the Four Seasons is the best hotel in town by a huge margin

Reviews.Title: “Overnight in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: NEBP
Reviews.Content: We have stayed a the Seattle Four Seasons on several occasions. Whether we are there for an evening at the Symphony, dinner in town, or to catch an early flight at SeaTac, the Four Seasons has always been a wonderful place to stay. The staff is oustanding and the valet/email/checkin process is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: yreme
Reviews.Content: Excellent service nice hotel decor. If traveling with children the hotel does a great job at recognizing them. Seattle has a few great hotels but none match the level of service that the Four Seasons offers. Location by Pikes Place Market is an added bonus. When booking your room check room size because they do vary. Lobby is limited so if planning any type of business conversation meet off site there is no place to talk in private.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business and leisure travelers”
Reviews.Author: hoostraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the wonderful four seasons for 3 nights for work and sightseeing. I've stayed at many different four seasons properties across the globe and this one is better than the average four seasons. The service is great. The front desk and lobby staff are super friendly and go out of their way to helpful. They made great restaurant recommendations (metropolitan grill was my fav) and assisted us in storing/refrigerating some food we purchased at nearby Pike market. The location is great - very close to the famous pike market and acquarium (great for kids). Seattle is a terrific walking city with lots of shopping choices and we found the four seasons to be a great home base to see everything. The room was very high quality and modern. Love the in mirror tv. Always appreciate the turn down service with complimentsry bottles of water. The housekeeping staff was invisible yet they always cleaned our room whenever we left the room, which is the way it should be. Had a nice view of the water from our room. Very nice room overall. The fitness center has pretty new equipment but not much choice. Nice views of the water from the treadmill. Pool was closed, outside only and pretty small. The spa was pleasant, and massage was good like most other four seasons spas. The locker room was a bit disappointing - small with a steam room but no sauna or whirlpool. Wifi Internet worked well but was expensive. Tv choices were great - even had nfl network. Had breakfast one morning and it was uneventful as the food was very average - you're better off walking to a nearby diner. Overall I would definitely recommend the four seasons Seattle to anyone traveling to Seattle for work or fun.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the best!”
Reviews.Author: princesscrunchy
Reviews.Content: Any Four Seasons Hotel is always exceptional but the Seattle location is my favorite; absolute perfection and all the staff remembers my name, every visit. This is the standard to which I judge all other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “When in Seattle a traveler cannot go wrong by staying at Four Seasons Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cathy Morris A
Reviews.Content: Four Season Hotel in Seattle is beautiful. The staff is above reproach and the food everything one could hope for. I loved my stay and will return anytime business takes me to Seattle

Reviews.Title: “Top notch”
Reviews.Author: sunshinedaydream1
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with great amenities. The room was very spacious and everything was very clean. I do wish that they would have coffee/tea available throughout the morning, was only able to get it one morning. The location was great, right across from Pike's Place Market.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to spend a few days”
Reviews.Author: BobnIdaho
Reviews.Content: I've been traveling to Seattle a lot lately and I have to say, if you want to be pampered then the Four Seasons is the place to stay. It's a very beautiful hotel and has wonderful staff. While some of the clientele seem to be stuffy I have always found the staff to be warm and friendly. The doormen get to know you and everyone seems to love working there. I will start with the location. The hotel is located right across from where the Pike Place Market starts. A quick walk out the front door and you are walking into the south end of the marketplace. Pike Brewery is not far inside the doors and they have some wonderful beers. If the market isn't your thing then you are only a few blocks from pretty much any type of store you could want. The Seattle Art Museum is also across the street and walking to the stadium for a Seahawks or Mariners game is quite doable. The Puget Sound is about a block to the west, and the hotel sits up above it all, so the views from the restaurant and bar (and if you are lucky, your room) are pretty spectacular. I have spent a lot of time at this hotel and with it's great location you are close to pretty much everything. Now on to the rooms. Being a Four Seasons the rooms are very comfortable. Depending on the size you are looking for you will find two double beds (not very large for two people to sleep in each) all the way up to huge king beds. The bedding is extremely comfortable. The tv's are all decent sized flatscreens as well as the bathroom has one built into the mirror. All of the rooms I have stayed in have had both a large tub and a separate glassed in shower. The toilet is also in it's own glassed in room. Some rooms have a separate living room too. There is a mini bar as well as a safe, etc. I have never had any issues with a room at this hotel. The hotel has a restaurant called Art. Being the Four Seasons the prices are pretty high, but they do pamper you, so the food (and the view) are worth it. There is a bar connected to the restaurant as well, with the same spectacular views (not sure if the bar has it's own name or not). They have different specials in the bar (cheese, chocolate, etc) in the evenings and a lot of people seem to like coming in for those specials. I'm not sure if the specials are bar only or if you can get them in the restaurant too, but I would assume you can get them at both places. There is a business center with a computer and printer as well as an ATM. There is a spa I hear from friends is very good. There is an infinity pool as well as a fire pit. The hotel has a car service as well, so if the place you want to go is a bit out of walking range they can drop you off. This Four Seasons is exactly what you would expect from a Four Seasons. It is definitely expensive, but if you feel like being pampered while hanging out in Seattle it is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms and view”
Reviews.Author: dlcSilverSpring_MD
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great rooms and the views on the water side are great. The city side views - not so great. Service is attentive and all you would expect from Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Such a cool property and location!”
Reviews.Author: caa219
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in November and it was my first trip to Seattle. I wanted to near the tourist spots and didn't want to rent a car. Well, it was a long day of walking, but I think I managed to see everything on the beaten path. We had brunch both days at Art and one lunch. The food was delicious. The hotel feels very new and modern. Nice bar scene and fireplace.

Reviews.Title: “An ideal location in downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Azzrielish
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons Seattle for three nights in September. We selected the hotel based on Trip Advisor ratings and a "stay for 3 nights pay for 2 nights deal" (we paid $800 plus tax for three nights). The Pros: Location - at Union and 1st its in an ideal location, within easy walking distance to Pike Place Market, restuarants and the shopping area along Pine Street Rooms - our room was spacious, nicely decorated, comfortable Bathroom - LOVED the bathroom - it was large with a huge soaking tub and tv in the mirror Staff - couldnt have been nicer or more helpful The Cons: Price - not a hotel for the price conscious (which we normally are but I enjoyed the splurge) Restaurant - we ate in the restaurant one night and it was okay, but overpriced for what it was Pool area - its nice but much smaller that it looks on their website and its not at the top of the building (as I thought) but on a lower floor nestled between two towers. View - our room on the 8th floor overlooked 1st Avenue so it wasnt much to write home about The cons were very minor, and overall I still rate this hotel a solid 5* and would recommend it if cost is not a major factor in your decision.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice top end hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaulSEA1
Reviews.Content: I had a very good one night stay here at a hotel that truely fits in the luxury category. (Bill Gates supposedly owns one of the condos above) My room service was interesting and tasty. Everything in the room worked well and was comfortable and I really enjoyed the outdoor hot tub. Of course every little thing is very expensive but that's what you expect at a place like this. The view from the hot tub was great. My room cost $50 more for having a "partial view" of the sound which I took only because it was the last room available in Seattle that night. Please... Don't be silly, there was no view without getting a neck ache. This property offers everything I could think of wanting in a downtown Seattle luxury hotel. Oh yeah, the location is awesome with a great view and right by the Pike Place market and walking distance to everything downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons never disappoints”
Reviews.Author: carolineBethesdaMd
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in a corner Elliott Bsy Suite with my husband and my son. The hotel room was very nicely appointed, but I was not crazy about the color scheme, if I can be picky. The room was very comfortable and well-appointed, and very clean. One thing that I did not understand was why they didn't put any heating vents in the bathroom. It was a very chilly day in Seattle, and the bathroom was always very cold. Heated floors would have been a nice touch. Other than that, I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Close to excellent”
Reviews.Author: amsf
Reviews.Content: I've statyed at the Four Seasons twice and would have rated it as excellent but on my second stay, when I visited with my wife, I booked a higher priced room which, oddly, wasn't as good as the lower category I'd had the time before. It was bigger but not really in a useful way - for example the bathtub in the smaller room was positioned so you could watch the very cool 'in mirror' TV whilst you couldn't do this in the larger room. Also the first room was nice and quiet at the end of a corridor with great views whilst the larger room was near the elevator, and had an adjoining room where the TV was clearly audible from our room - and the view wasn't as good as it had the other two sides of the hotel sticking out and getting in the way (it's sort of a 'C' shape'). Given those factors I didn't feel it was particularly great value. On the plus side the rooms are nicely furnished, the pool (and gym) have great views, food was excellent in the restaurant and service up to normal Four Seasons standards. Hotel is also well located next to Pike Place market (and near the very first Starbucks if you need a touristy fix!). Would stay again but will be more careful on room choice.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny, we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: EofSeattle
Reviews.Content: We were celebrating our anniversary and the staff went out of their way to make our stay special from the moment we arrived! We will remember this weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Had fabulous night away with a couple of girlfriends. Great service and the spa and pool/jacuzzi were excellent.”
Reviews.Author: sweetpeapoppet
Reviews.Content: Luxury right in the middle of Seattle. Close to SAM, Pike Place Market and the shops. Cool bar - and the outdoor pool, although small, has an incredible view. Ditto the jacuzzi. Spa very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great service.”
Reviews.Author: gregdbrown
Reviews.Content: Stay here every time I come to Seattle. Great location, great service. Food is good but many other places to eat close by.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as always.”
Reviews.Author: Ming C
Reviews.Content: Very accomodating for young children. Makes my life a lot easier not having to bring every single thing for the kids. Makes kids very comfortable. Hotel is very clean (they shampooed the carpet right before our arrival). Service is excellent, from the front doorman, front desk, to room service and housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location, Rooms & Service”
Reviews.Author: TheCriticalTraveller
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for 4 days, first the hotel rooms are just amazing! Had a view of the ocean which was great. I was here on business, but I would certainly return as a couple, top quality amenities, furniture, bed, and a huge bathroom. Location can't be beat, a block away from Pikes Market, great restaurants, bars, pubs all within a block or two Staff were all great and attentive, the morning coffee in the lobby was a nice touch. As for the the conference, the food was great! For a great "locals" bar, check out the Alibi Room in Post Alley, just under the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence by the sound”
Reviews.Author: fozzetti
Reviews.Content: This is a stellar hotel sitting right on the edge of the sound. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, with excellent appointments. All just what you'd expect from a Four Seasons. The service is equally charming and attentive. This the kind of hotel that makes travelling the perfect mix of adventure and creature comforts.

Reviews.Title: “Typical 4 Seasons, done in class!”
Reviews.Author: debuyama
Reviews.Content: Awesome view of the water from the bar and restaurant. If you frequent the hotel the bell hops and front desk know your name before you arrive. The rooms are huge and spacious and awesome bathroom. You also pay through the nose and I hate the fact that with a $500/night room they don't have free Wifi. That really pisses me off. Luxury comforts.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to end vacation.”
Reviews.Author: Amber A
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after returning from Orcas Island for our last day and night of vacation. We were upgraded and the room was fabulous. Service was out of this world. Stop into Fran's chocolate shop for an extra special sweet. The infinity pool is beautiful and oh so serene. Fitness center is well equipped and has a great view. Staff arrived several minutes into my workout and brought water to me on the treadmill... with a lid and straw, which just happened to fit perfectly into the cup holder... Now that's service!

Reviews.Title: “luxury and comfort in downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: piteryunior
Reviews.Content: Only few tips : prefer seaview high floor ( noise from first road in the opposite side ) ; visit the swimming pool in the happy hour time ; walk up and down in the city to appreciate the location of this hotel . The rate is expansive ( try special offers ) but it is a very Four Seasons with comfort and perfect service .

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “My Sixth Stay”
Reviews.Author: Rodnam
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in five or six different hotels in Seattle - The Four Seasons gets a premium price but nothing compares to it in service, luxury, comfort or location!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrific service and outstanding lounge/bar.”
Reviews.Author: DebE51
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great if you want to visit the waterfront and Pikes Market. The Market is just a block away, and we walked to lots of good restaurants from this location even though we had a car as well. Hotel also has car service for the guests which we used one evening and was terrific. We visited the lounge one evening and ended up in the middle of their happy hour which also features a wonderful cheese side bar with lots of great tasty fruits, nuts and breads which ended up being dinner one night.

Reviews.Title: “All good or great - pool is a delightful extra”
Reviews.Author: Less_is_more2
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in early September in a harbour facing room. Fulfilled the usual high Four Seasons standard. Location is great - within walking distance of many things and easy reach of the main public transport. Best point: the pool and sunbathing area were an unexpected delight. The area is in shade until about lunchtime but then catches the sun for the rest of the day. There is drinks and food service. It's fantastic to have this facility in a city centre. Disappointing: the bar is functional but not an an interesting or welcoming space. Four Seasons can do good bars - like the one in New York - and this one needs some excitement.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, Classic Four Season Service”
Reviews.Author: asoaring_eagle
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights on business. Got a corner room with two double beds. Good views on both sides. Good sized room. Fantastic bathroom. Quality fixtures. Quite air conditioning. Wonderful professional service. Nice business center where I printed my boarding pass. The hotel is within walking distance to mostly everything, or within inexpensive cab ride distance. (Seattle downtown is a really nice walking downtown so I would walk instead of catching a cab whenever possible.) Would definitely stay here again. At the end of the conference, I also got a massage at the Spa. I was settled into a room overlooking the Elliot Bay. All the facilities are top-notched. The bed was heated, the pillow was adjusted, and the room was sizable. My massage therapist was Lauren. I just have to say, her techniques are superb. She worked my kinks in silence and hit all the right spots. Would definitely come here again.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay when in Seattle.”
Reviews.Author: Frank B
Reviews.Content: Great location in downtown. The staff is over the top helpful with any requests or questions. The room was spotless, and the bed was extremely comfortable. The Puget Sound views were breathtaking. The room service was always on time and ready with the morning newspaper and a big warm smile. The hotel made a few dinner reservations for us and we always got an excellent table with great wait staff. Even the front door staff is terrific; always willing to gladly open any doors for you and to get or arrange for transportation. Stay away from the hotel bar area during sunset, it gets very warm and bright and the bar maids can become a little less helpful when asked to lower the shades.

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong with the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: kimmi8
Reviews.Content: But you will pay $$$$ for the amenities that come with it. :) That's to be expected though as it's one of the nicest hotels in the city. The neighborhood, while close to tourist attractions, can be a bit dodgy at night. It's right by the water though and has really pretty views during the day. The rooms are immaculate, with lots of closet space and square footage. The bathrooms are to die for and great for couples. Probably my favorite thing about the hotel. Marble floors and tub, TV inside the mirror and rainforest shower heads. Amazing. The fitness room while small comes with nice amenities like ice-cold towels and lemon infused water. There's also an infinity pool outside if you prefer to do laps in the morning instead.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Four Seasons property right near Pike Place Market”
Reviews.Author: spenclo
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel located near the Pike Place Market in downtown Seattle. A cool roof-top, infinity edge pool. Wonderful service and rooms and butler service to place close by the resort in the house Jag is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: stefohnee
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a few hotels in Seattle, and this is by far the best. I live here but it's nice to stay somewhere and get away from all the worries at home once in a while. The customer service here is top-notch, the rooms are really nice, the pool area is AMAZING (do NOT forget your swimsuit or swim trunks!) and they have a jag that can take you around the downtown Seattle area. Oh, and ART restaurant has great food. I have never stayed at a FS before, but I think I might just be a convert! I checked in on a Friday night, since I would be going to a winemaker's dinner at ART restaurant and didn't want to worry about getting home for the night. (And to wind down from a family vacation in the woods during the previous week.) I was checked in quickly (seriously, 2 minutes, tops! And that's probably because we requested a shaving kit, haha) and directed up to the room. On the way to the elevator there was a pitcher of apple cider to drink, and apple rings and a little thing about apples since it's fall and you're in Washington. The city view room was small, but nice - a bit dim, but clean and with an amazing bathroom! marble everywhere, tv inside the mirror so you can watch from the shower, ridiculously deep bath tub for soaking, and a shower with 2 heads - rainshower and normal, and you could have them both on at once or just one at a time. L'Occitane soap and shampoo, fluffy towels and robes. Heaven! The bed was super comfortable, and I could only barely hear the sounds of the street 8 floors below (the room looked out over the SAM). I'd heard a lot about the rooftop infinity pool, but didn't get a chance to check it out that night. Instead, I got up early for a swim. Well, we've been having some beautiful late summer weather lately, and I was surprised it was completely empty. Went for a swim and called room service to have breakfast delivered to the pool. YES, that's right. Pool breakfast. I figured if they can bring room service to your room, then why not the pool?! They sent someone down with menus, and sadly he didn't come back for like 10 minutes so we just called up again and told them what we wanted. Swam some more and then had a plate of hot, fluffy lemon ricotta pancakes with sides of lemon curd and blackberry jam, plus a nice big glass of ice water (yay! I hadn't asked, but was going to!) and a side of chicken sausage. Best breakfast I've had in a while - I am definitely going to get this again the next time I stay. $16 well spent! Really, my only complaint is that parking is $40/day, so we took the bus - I can think of much better things to spend my money on than that. Other than that, this place is just amazing - I think staying there is going to become a a regular occurence. I can't believe I paid even more to stay at the Edgewater recently! I'll just have to stay at the FS more until that is just a faded memory :)

Reviews.Title: “All around perfection with a view”
Reviews.Author: In-the-know88
Reviews.Content: Was here with family in two rooms overlooking Puget Sound - beautiful view (dont look down though as in front of the hotel is a grungy old building, but whatever...deal with it). The service was excellent - the concierge was great - getting us great tickets for a Mariners game, although that is not the hottest ticket in baseball). The concierge also hunted down a pair of swim goggles way after the pool staff had left. Went well beyond the call of duty and made one child very happy. The restaurant was fantastic for lunch - our kids had a great meal too and they did something so special for them (I wont mention, since I am not sure they want to repeat it over and over...) but the restaurant manager was a perfect gentleman, the waitress was so nice. Room service was always perfect too - no reason to leave for dinner (although it is very expensive and I am not a fan of built in service charges - let me be decide that). The salmon with Indian spices was excellent - the chowder is a meal itself. So overall - cost was high, but if that is not the issue and you want a perfect hotel located right in the action, then there is no reason to look for another hotel in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “One night was definitely not enough”
Reviews.Author: Marie H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed overnight on a quick trip up from Vancouver. The hotel is in a great location, only a couple of minutes walk to the Farmer's Market. We found the staff to be very friendly and efficient, especially the concierge, a lovely lass called Meaghan. As we were new to the city, she was able to suggest several places to visit and also which public transport to take. Our room was excellent with a lovely view onto the pool area. I was delighted to see they had a firepit for guests to sit by in the morning after a swim while waiting for the sun to appear. We enjoyed cocktails in the lounge but didn't get to try the restaurant, although the menu was impressive, as we were going elsewhere for dinner. We would definitely recommend the Four Seasons. Also look out for the yummy chocolate shop adjacent to the foyer

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: krahnic
Reviews.Content: One could not ask for a better property or better service. I would certainly not hesitate in staying @ Four Seasons in Seattle again.

Reviews.Title: “TOP FS PROPERTY”
Reviews.Author: frenchandparisian
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms at the FS property using the Stay Longer promotion, which showed up for a very short time on their web site. Upon check-in, only one of the rooms was ready, but that we were right out from the transatlantic flight from Paris, and a little early. This room was upgraded from a City View to a Partial Bay View. My special request for the second room to be on the upper floors took some time for housekeeping to get around, but the reception staff was very nice and got us on the top floor, in the Partial Bay View that we had booked. I can't understand the people complaining about the view of the factory and/or the Alaskan Freeway. It is there for everyone to know, and each traveller doing the minimal research might be aware of it. As for the overall situation, it can't be beat, and is absolutely the best maney can buy. Rooms are arranged in a typical FS way. Nothing really typical from the area, but that's what one might expect with FS. All has been said about the TV within the bathroom mirror, the beds and everything. I should note that my special request of additionnal toiletries and 4 bath towels at any time, which I have been doing for years at each FS reservation -and that nobody ever cared to implement in my profile- was honoured from day 1 and continuously from then on. I complained after the first night that something wwas wrong with the bed. It was sloped especially on one side, and obviously needed to be flipped over. They actually put a new mattress, and made the right follow up to make sure I was happy about it. Good point. We used valet a lot. Prompt and efficient and not cheap. We had breakfast every morning at ART. Nice settings, although you have the best possible view over the factory. Cooked breakfast is good but not spectacular. The buffet might seem a bargain, but the variety of food is just not right, and in my view far below FS standards. Something I found weird when waiting in the lobby : hords of tourists come in, have a look round the first floor, and leave. They do not have a shop. Some signature items are available from the spa, at limited times of the day. Luggage were delivered fast enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location.”
Reviews.Author: Megking
Reviews.Content: The staff was great and very helpful. Rooms were large and very comfortable. I would definitely go back for the great service.

Reviews.Title: “One word: Amazing”
Reviews.Author: abullied
Reviews.Content: Outstanding service, incredible amenities, and great views. Anytime you can stay at a Four Seasons, definitely do. The one in downtown Seattle is close to attractions, shopping, and outstanding restaurants. An experience that I will always hold as the baseline for hotels I stay at in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: CorkPaddyD
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel and services, would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and convenience”
Reviews.Author: Mylo_Dallas
Reviews.Content: The location was great and convenience...in the heart of Seattle. Enjoyed our stay very much and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Urban Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jason G
Reviews.Content: We were just at the Four Seasons Seattle with our two daughters - ages 9 and 5. Pool is small but filled with kids. Housekeeping, reception, concierge - all went out of their way to make our stay with kids more enjoyable. Great, central location - proximate to ferries, restaurants and the Market. We all loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: RBW027
Reviews.Content: We just spent 5 nights at this hotel. The entire experience was beyond excellent! The best staff of any hotel we've stayed in. Rooms were very nice, comfortable and well appointed. And nice roomy bathroom! Can't wait to go back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Service, Location, Pool”
Reviews.Author: athena2012
Reviews.Content: I live near Seattle and stay overnight in downtown Hotels at least 2-3 of times per year for various reasons. This trip was a birthday celebration for my mother and I; our birthdays fall within a week of each other. I have stayed in more than a dozen downtown Seattle Hotels and so far the Edgewater and the Westin have been my favorites. I will now add The Four Seasons to my Top 3 list. This trip it was a toss-up between Hotel 1000 (where I have not yet stayed) and the (new) Four Seasons. The Four Seasons won primarily due to location. It is 1 block from the Pike Place Market. What sets the Four Seasons apart from other downtown Hotels are three things: The amazing outdoor pool (seasonal), its prime location particularly in proximity to the Market, and its exceptional service. Service, service, service. Before arriving I received a friendly email inquiring about what type of tea I like (prompted by my request for an in room kettle). We arrived at about 1:00 pm as they were preparing our room. We strolled over to the Market and returned about an hour later. Upon entering room 810 we observed the requested kettle and tea along with the refrigerator we wanted for our bottled waters, and the chocolate strawberries I had requested. A hand written welcome note, penned by Ms. Alana Jackson, was neatly placed on the table (nice touch). The interior of the room was comfortable and spacious-- higher end modern--comparable to many boutique Hotels you find in cities all over the world, nothing extraordinary. The bathtub was a standout, much deeper and larger than most. The artwork was interesting. Once piece was unusual if not a bit disturbing, reminiscent of Munch's "The Scream." I noticed a piece in the Hallway that appeared to have been painted by the same artist. We threw ourselves onto the beds, temporarily exhausted. Eying the room service menu we opted to share a piece of decadent chocolate cake. Yummy. With a non-fat latte for me that ran about $27.00. (The room service is, simply put, too expensive and uninspired given the variety of nearby restaurants and cafes to choose from.) Likewise the spa is overpriced comparable to day spas and other Hotel spas in the area. Come dinnertime (around 8:30 pm) we were leisurely exploring the meaning of nothingness when I spied the Japonessa Restaurant across the street from our window. Not wanting to get all dolled up and go out we did the logical thing, which was to call the concierge to inquire about delivery service. Here is where the Four Seasons unsurpassed service comes in. The concierge advises me that, unfortunately, the Japonessa does not deliver. Without skipping a beat he asks if he can send up the restaurant's menu and offers to pick up and deliver our order. How cool was that? Meanwhile, we took a dip in the outdoor pool. A heated infinity pool under the stars is a thing of beauty. The food from Japonessa arrived; it was delicious. I highly recommend the vegetable tempura. We slept like newborn pups in under the crisp white linens. The beds are comparable to Westin's "Heavenly" experience. The next day we made use of the Hotel's car service--a Jaguar of course--which took us the several blocks we were too lazy (and too bogged down with packages from the fresh fruit stands at the Market) to walk. BTW, you can get a beautiful bouquet of flowers at the Market for a mere 5 bucks. Incredible. Staying at the Seattle Four Seasons was a stress free and very enjoyable experience; I highly recommend this Hotel, but politely suggest they lower the spa and room service rates a bit, particularly in view of the present economic climate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GIMD
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed at. The rooms (we had a suite) were beautiful and the service impeccable. The pool area is quite small but was fine for our young kids. There were several families with children at the pool so we felt very welcome. Food was good but expensive as would be expected. The hotel is as close to the water as you can get and very convenient. I could walk a few blocks to all the restaurants, shopping, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel with incredible service!”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly530
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here the week of our wedding (which also was held at the Four Seasons Seattle) and had the opportunity to experience both their standard room and their suites. Both were lovely - the beds are incredibly comfy and the views on the Puget Sounds side are stunning! The staff are all top-notch and they made us feel welcome every time we stepped foot in the hotel. It probably didn't hurt that we were getting married there and thus spending lots of $$$$, but I'd stopped by the hotel several times prior to our stay (unannounced) and always found the staff to be friendly and welcoming, so I assume it is a de facto attitude and not just something they did because they knew who we were. Location is wonderful - walking distance to all of Seattle's main attractions, easy access to the Light Rail to the airport, and convenient for guests arriving in Seattle pre- or post-cruise. All in all, a beautiful property that I can't wait to visit again (with the husband now)!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great locale & surprisingly great weather!”
Reviews.Author: rhubarb07666
Reviews.Content: just completed a 4 night stay in a deluxe elliott bay suite...luxury unsurpassed, staff amazingly friendly & helpful. pool area, albeit small, decadent in its service. room service quick & efficient-person who answered the phone noticed i had a cold, sent up a complimentary cup of tea w/honey! concierge, eric loan in particular, assisted in helping us plan our trip in advance, reservations, taxis, etc...all handled w/the utmost of professionalism.

Reviews.Title: “usual outstanding 4S property and service, plus Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: JoozUK
Reviews.Content: As Four Seasons fans, this hotel certainly didn't disappoint - usual impeccable service and quality premises. The location is amazing too - a stone's throw from Pikes Place Market and countless eateries plus water front. We were given a room upgrade too which was a lovely gesture. We stayed for 6 days - 3 days either side of a cruise to Alaska- and the hotel stored some luggage for us for the week while we were gone, free of charge. Can't recommend highly enough. Oh and whilst the food in Art's is awesome, there are soooo many places to eat nearby I wouldn't book bed and breakfast - go eat out and experience Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, Awesome property, Awesome staff!”
Reviews.Author: nbk5276
Reviews.Content: I am from the Seattle area, and stayed here overnight for a weekend in town to see a concert. As soon as we pulled in, we were promptly greeted and offered help with our bags, we politely declined as we only had overnight bags. Check in was fast and efficient. Before you knew it we were in our room. The room design was modern and clean. The bathroom was stunning with a very deep soaker tub and awesome shower with an overhead rain shower. One of my key criteria on rating a room is the shower and the water pressure. This one was top notch! The tv in the mirror was a nice touch which would be expected in a 5 star property. My other main criteria is the bed. This bed was uber comfy. i slept like a baby! After coming in pretty late from a concert it was nice to see the room turned down for bed, with the ice bucket filled and bottles of water on both nightstands. What a nice touch. We used the lounge prior to the concert. The cocktails are delicious if a tad pricey. But for being in a 5 star hotel I was not surprised at the prices. We also had breakfast in the hotel restaurant. The quality of food was amazing. I believe much of the produce is sourced from the nearby pike place market a major tourist draw. I would definitely recommend this place to out of town visitors and family, and would not hesitate to spend another weekend here for another special event like a concert.

Reviews.Title: “Calming retreat - No worries here! They take care of you.”
Reviews.Author: Luke4Me
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently visited Seattle together with our young adult daughter, to visit our son at Ft. Lewis. Traveling takes so much out of us any more. The Four Seasons Seattle is like an oasis: it's right in the midst of busy downtown Seattle, but it is calm inside and everyone seems to be there just to make life easier for you. This is a great place to stay. The main reason I don't give it all excellent scores is that I am a picky person, so it takes perfection to get an excellent score from me. A good rating from me is, well, pretty close to perfect. Specific to this visit's ratings: 1) as to value, well, it is priced appropriately for what you get, but it isn't over the top; 2) as to sleep quality, we have our issues independent of the hotel and it doesn't ever reach perfection any more; and 3) in re to cleanliness, although throughout our stay I would rate it excellent, there was a very minor bloop noticed when we first entered the room. Staff is outstanding, and more than make up for these very minor issues. I definitely recommend Four Seasons Hotel Seattle for a fine hotel experience!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Seattle hotel... everytime!”
Reviews.Author: EatShopTravelEnjoy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times on business (I travel to Seattle 6-10 times per year) and have never been disappointed. The staff is phenom - always friendly and helpful. The beds are extremely comfortable. The rooms are spacious. (Did I mention there is a full stall shower, a soaking tub, AND a TV in the bathroom mirror?) The location is incredible. My only complaint about this place is that I have to leave... although I suppose I could move into one of their residential units. The little touches and personable service at this hotel cannot be beat in the Seattle area.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, excellent value, would highly recommend.”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen F
Reviews.Content: A large group of family and friends stayed at the Grand Hyatt for our daughter's wedding. Everyone experienced great service and received tremendous value compared to other Seattle hotels. The staff was extremely helpful when trying to make arrangements for guests who were arriving from all parts of the country. Great concierge service, restaurant staff was always willing to divide bills, great location in the city close to shopping and monorail.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: luvexploring
Reviews.Content: The location of The Four Seasons is perfect to Pike's market. I don't think we could have gotten any closer. We actually stayed at this hotel to be close to the market. The room was beautiful and spacious. We had Mother's Day Brunch at their restraunt and it was amazing, absolutely amazing. The food presentation was beautiful and everything tasted perfect. The food service was great also. Great shopping is within walking distance, along with many restraunts. The only thing I would say that was slightly negative about this hotel, is they are not very friendly when you're looking for advice or information. They seemed to be bothered by to many questions and never engaged in offering suggestions easily. We visited Pike's market every day we were there and the market was filled with happy energy and good foods.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing bad to say.”
Reviews.Author: Fleetcat
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel with a complicated view. The beautiful Puget Sound forms the backdrop with the foreground being a Public Storage Depot and a some type of industrial plant. I actually quite liked the juxtaposition however it may not be everybody’s cup of tea. Room décor is subdued mustards, greens, beiges and blondes as expected in a Four Seasons Hotel – in my experience they seem to favour this palate. I find it rather bland but it is unchallenging and nothing to object to which I guess is the intent. And this for me sums up the hotel. It did nothing wrong but – other than the view – is pretty unmemorable. Great staff, nice food, expensive bar – just the norm. The location is very near to Pike Street Market which is a great place to visit if you find being in packed into a crowd, who have no spatial awareness, a fun time. For me hell on earth.

Reviews.Title: “one night was not enough”
Reviews.Author: 1trillium
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a cruise and loved it. Everyone there was helpful and friendly. The hotel is newer so everything is still fresh and clean. I have a two year old and let them know when I made the reservations, if you have little ones this will be helpful for you. They set up a bed with side rails, a mini robe, and little slippers as well as a toy (which was a gift for her to keep). They also put toiletries in the bathroom for babies. The view from our room was phenomenal, the market one block away. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I expected and more.”
Reviews.Author: travelmedstudent
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in late December. The room was immaculate and bed was amazing. The windows span the length of the floor which is nice and it offers a great view, we had windows that spanned the length (horizontal) of our room facing the mountains and sea. The bath was nice, separate toilet and bath as well as shower, lots of glass and TV in the mirror. Everyone at the hotel was great, no complaints there. The hotel is also a short walk from Pike's Place as well as some of the more notable attractions the city has to offer. There's also a staircase right next to the hotel that takes you right down to the docks. Across the street is the Seattle Art museum. Overall the hotel was perfect, clean, new, and a great place to sleep. Would come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful!”
Reviews.Author: lesliek
Reviews.Content: Great pool, lovely room, fabulous location and 4 seasons service

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great location, great rooms,great service, great staff. Just another day at a Four Seasons Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: grababagngo
Reviews.Content: Without realizing it we arrived at the hotel when Manchester United was staying there. After I had to be told who they were(we aren't soccer fans!)we proceeded to have a fabulous stay despite the total chaos that MU presence brought to the hotel. With hundreds of fans outside the hotel, kept behind police tape, my family and I were able to come and go without any hassle. Not even so much as being asked to show proof we were guests in order to re-enter the hotel. It's that Four Seasons magic-they had a security system in place that protected those that needed it but didn't hassle other hotel guests. The hotel rooms are beautiful. Our party had 2-one waterfront corner 1 bedroom suite and one waterfront deluxe room. The deluxe room was so spacious that I had to make sure it wasn't the suite before the kids settled into it! Location fabulous. Right across the street from the art museum, right at Pike's Market. Very close to lots of what's happening in Seattle. If you have the time arrange a tour of the city on your first day, DO IT!! The concierge set up small group van tour which was 3 hours and very interesting. Even went out to the locks and saw the boats coming through them. Also saw the "steps" at the locks. The fish ladder built to facilitate fish returning upstream to spawn. We spent about 1/2 hour at the locks. It was a nice break from sitting in a tour van and this part of the tour really catches the children's attention. If you're a fish lover than Seattle is the right town for you. We had some of the freshest, most creatively prepared fish on this trip. Don't miss the opportunity when in Seattle to enjoy the fish-and of course the coffee!! A coffee shop on every corner! My coffee addicted husband thought he'd died and gone to heaven! Hard not to have fun in this town and can't wait to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, We'll Be Back But Eat Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: PortlandORGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the Deluxe Bay-View Rooms, #815 and it was lovely with more than enough space for 3. We opted for a king bed over 2 doubles because sometimes our child ends up in our bed and it was worth a try to see if she'd sleep in a roll-away. The roll-away wasn't necessary because there was a chaise she claimed as her bed; someone from housekeeping made it up with pillows and blankets. This wouldn't work for a child over the age of 10 likely but, it works well for a younger child and gave us more space than we would have had with a roll-away As always in a Four Seasons, the service was friendly and accommodating. The pool was fantastic, although not large. Cocktail service was wonderful although it seemed there was an interesting LA contingent visiting the hotel that weekend, maybe a cruise crowd? I needed a refrigerator for medication and they were more than helpful. The refrigerator was large and had a small freezer, perfect for my ice packs for the trip home. The mini-bar is not suitable for refrigeration as it's one of those pre-stocked, automatic charge units that doesn't really refrigerate things so if you need a refrigerator, ask when making reservations. They mentioned children's amenities and we were given a child-sized robe & slippers the day after check-in. The cons... Typical of Four Seasons, the mattresses are dreadful and Seattle's Four Seasons does not buck that trend. I wish they'd contract with the W or Westin and use their mattresses instead. It's one of the few things that always deters from my stays at any Four Seasons. The food at ART was mediocre at best, tasteless like elegant hospital food. I made my reservations online and was automatically put into the bed and breakfast program so we ate there 2 mornings and I would say it is absolutely not worth it, particularly when there are good restaurants just around the corner (Steelhead Cafe is a good one). Due to weather issues, we were unable to depart on the day planned. While at friends', I called to extend our checkout in case the weather improved and late checkout is a mere 1/2 hour later than regular checkout (noon). While on the phone, it became clear that it was not safe to fly and I asked if they had availability for one more night (a Monday night) and was told no, they were completely booked. I found that odd since it seemed the hotel was not full but anything is possible. Twenty minutes after my call, my husband went to the front desk and said that we'd been told there was no availability; would they mind calling the W to see if they had availability for the night? Suddenly they had rooms available and we needn't move our things. Surely they could have bothered to discover that while I was on the phone with them. Regardless of the cons, we enjoyed our stay and will likely stay there again. The service, location and views are outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Four Seasons Experience”
Reviews.Author: NatalieLovesDub
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had an unexpected 24 hour layover in Seattle on our way to Cambodia. As my husband had never been to Seattle, we picked the Four Seasons for its proxemity to the waterfront and Pike's Market. The rooms were beautiful. We enjoyed the large soaking tub, the ability to watch the news in the mirror while getting dressed in the morning, and the view of the water. Just like all Four Seasons stays, this one was fantastic. The only negative could happen anywhere...I left my jewelry pouch on the made bed. It had several irreplaceable items int it. I called within 45 minutes of checking out but they didn't have any of their staff members report it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Seattle location!”
Reviews.Author: jimstooth
Reviews.Content: Rooms are nice....well appointed! Received a free upgrade! Ate at Art the hotel resturant....really good, but not super busy! Lounge was very busy though. Outdoor pool was great!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent--better than a typical Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: jah123
Reviews.Content: The Seattle 4S has an excellent location. A nice view of the harbor along with being near the Art Museum and Pikes Market. also very convenient to go jogging along the bay through very nice parks. I liked the decor of the hotel--light woods. Room was comfortable and well equipped to work in. Service was excellent as expected. The fitness room is also nice along with the pool. Staff was friendly and answered all questions. I found this 4S to have a customer friendly attitude beyond what I typically encounter when I stay at 4S in the US. I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “I really liked this hotel and will be a returning guest!”
Reviews.Author: Bigboy786
Reviews.Content: A very well managed and run hotel. Everything was just perfect! Great location and very nice and freindly staff. The rooms were very comfortable and very clean! Ten out of ten.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice! Clean and modern rooms. Hospitable staff. Conveniently located!"”
Reviews.Author: John_Rhodes_55
Reviews.Content: Very nice! I would recommend this hotel. Clean and modern rooms and bath. Hospitable staff. Conveniently located!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: FelliniLover
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for part of our 30th Anniversary trip; it was the best part of our vacation. From the extremely knowledgeable and courteous concierge, the restaurants, room service, everything was an experience to remember. The room had a water view and the bed was like laying on the clouds. The hotel was located across the street from an entrance to Pike Place Market and within walking distance of the major shops. I wouldn't hesitate to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven! I checked in and never wanted to check out.”
Reviews.Author: Kerigrace
Reviews.Content: The rooms are bright and modern. Everything you need. The windows are floor to ceiling. The pool and deck area are amazing. Great food! There's a Fran's chocolate in the lobby. (my favorite) A two block walk to Pike Place Market. I am very hard to please. This is a FANTASTIC city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Four Seasons pampering in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: georgetowers
Reviews.Content: Property is in great location, halfway between the piers, sightseeing and shopping districts (key since it is a hilly city). Superb service and beautifully maintained property. Nice restaurant/bar, and welcoming lobby. The tv in the bathroom mirror is a cool gadget and convenient amenity. The best activity in the hotel: watch the sunset while enjoying a bottle of nice Washington Cabernet or Syrah and marveling at the Puget Sound view by the fire pit in the pool/jacuzzi area! Standard Superior Room and City-View Room are ok. Do not get a Partial Bay View Room as the part of the view that is not the bay is a less than desirable view (unappealing residential building with residents looking your way). And to look at the bay you need to strain your neck next to the window. Best choice is a Deluxe Bay-View Room or, if willing to splurge, any of the suites.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: jilltraveler
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic. It may be one of the best Four Seasons that I have stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Wedding Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: tickettoride81
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Four Seasons for three nights during our wedding weekend. We had a nice, large room with an excellent view of the water (over the viaduct and some buildings, as others have noted). The bed was nicely positioned so you could lay in bed while enjoying the views. The bathroom was great with a large soaking tub as well as a separate double headed shower. We ordered room service for breakfast all three mornings and all of the food was fabulous. (Though the coffee was a bit disappointing, as we live in Seattle and know much better coffee is to be found nearby.) We also had dinner in the restaurant, ART, one night, which was also very good. The view isn't quite as good at the restaurant because its on the first floor, but it still had a great ambiance and our food exceeded our expectations for a hotel restaurant. The day after our wedding we had absolutely heavenly massages at the spa. The massage tables are the most comfortable I've ever been on. As a honeymoon treat, they offered us complimentary chocolate covered strawberries in the relaxation room after our treatment, which added to our wonderful experience. After our massages we went out to the pool deck for a cocktail and a light lunch. The pool area is very nice, though it was overcrowded with families given that it was a nice Sunday afternoon. We got the only two loungers available, though I should note an employee helped us find them and set them up for us. All in all it was very relaxing to lounge by the pool, even with all of the kids splashing around in the pool. We were very happy we chose the Four Seasons for our wedding weekend stay - our pre-honeymoon. The staff is fabulous, the beds are heavenly, and I honestly had absolutely no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “The best experience from start to finish!”
Reviews.Author: Lynn253
Reviews.Content: Stay at least two nights if you can so you can take full advantage of the amazing pool and spa. Their is so much to do just steps away from the hotel that we ran out of time to enjoy everything in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's Four Seasons, and you get the best”
Reviews.Author: schvitz
Reviews.Content: This is our third visit to 4S Seattle. We're spoiled, and you will probably see me replicating this review for any 4S property. 4S Seattle is particularly nice for an urban hotel because it is not a large property. The modern rooms are finely decorated and are exceptionally comfortable. Nice gym, but pool is a tad small for my taste [about 50 ft], since I like to swim laps. Lovely water view, even with Seattle Steam across the way, which actually adds to the appeal of the vista [think Pompidou Museum for real].

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Views and Exquisite Service”
Reviews.Author: OrcasIslandDream
Reviews.Content: We were warmly greeted at check-in and that warmth was maintained throughout our three night stay. Upon check-in we we received a complimentary upgrade to a deluxe bay view room and thoroughly enjoyed watching the ferries and cruise ships come and go and getting a glimpse of the Olympic Mountains beyond Elliot Bay. In addition, we were treated to a bottle of sparkling wine and chocolate covered strawberries as an anniversary was being celebrated during our stay. We ate our breakfast at ART and everthing was delicious, especially the lemon ricotta pancakes. The location was convenient to everything. We walked through Pike Place Market and to Safeco Field for a Mariner's game. We aren't big shoppers but the shopping core was within a few blocks. If we ever need to stay in a hotel in Seattle again,we would definitely stay at the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel in Seattle; great location; amazing service”
Reviews.Author: markanddipa
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 night stay in Seattle for work. Four Seasons was fantastic. The rooms and location (50 yards from Pike Place) were great, and the service even better. I left home in a hurry and forgot shaver, deodorant and cufflinks. The hotel had the first two up to my room in around 2 minutes, and for the cufflinks they were able to get a contact at Brooks Brothers to open the store for them at 7:30am, and they brought back a pair of exactly what I asked for, well in advance of when I needed to leave for work that morning. I will definitely be back and will try to bring the family on vacation there as well. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Come for the rooms, stay for the view”
Reviews.Author: johnpaul17
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Seattle is very well located, across from the Art Museum, a block from the Pike Market, and near most downtown locations of interest. The staff was extremely attentive, kind, and respectful. Views from the room are breathtaking. The hotel is modern and unlike most Four Season properties, but the rooms were quiet and peaceful. The hotel was a great choice for the end of our weeklong trip to the Pacific Northwest.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: johnathome
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Seattle for a client hosted event. Our meetings were held in the Four Seasons. The hotel is the bottom 10 floors and with the top floors being residences. Arrived by cab and the bell hop promptly took my bag and took it to reception for me. I checked in around 3pm with no problems. No lines and plenty of folk at reception and at the concierge desk. Had a room on the 7th floor (partial view of the harbor which is blocked by a smoke stack which I'm sure the hotel isnt too happy about) overlooking the swimming pool on the 2nd floor. Room was very spacious with a huge bathroom with separate bathtub and shower. TV in the mirror but with only a few channels. I had a King bed. Large HD TV in the room with plenty of channels. Lots of drawer space and nice sized closet. Work desk was very comfortable with plenty of plugs and nice artemide lamps. Wifi connection was good at $11 for each day. Turn down service at night would leave a bottle of water each night and fill the ice bucket. Used the gym which is quite small. Modern equipment with tv and weights. Did not use the tiny pool (cold and rainy during my stay). Did not try the restaurant in the hotel. Check-out was seamless. Do tell the desk ahead of time to get a cab as they aren't lined up outside waiting for people. Overall, very nice stay, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Another flawless stay!”
Reviews.Author: DiscerningTraveler88
Reviews.Content: We had high expectations for the Four Seasons Seattle and they were met (and in some cases exceeded) yet again. The first night, we arrived after a long day and a well past our collective bed times, coming from the East Coast. Our daughter wanted new batteries for her camera. She asked us several times and I kept saying tomorrow, tomorrow. The gentleman setting up her rollaway asked if he could take it and fix it. I didn't want to impose, but as it was so important to her, I agreed. It wasn't 10 minutes before he was back with a child's robe and slippers, and the camera with brand new batteries (it needed a phillips head screwdriver to open the battery compartment. I am not sure if this "made" our trip, but it was just another example of this excellent hotel going above and beyond. The pool was beautiful and our room was fantastic. We also appreciated the assistance of the bellman and their interest in our daughter and her itinerary (they remembered and asked where she had gone the day before). Overall, another great stay! (Also the spa treatment - facial- was fantastic.)

Reviews.Title: “Typical 4 Seasons”
Reviews.Author: pico723
Reviews.Content: Great service, location (very close to Pike Market) & the beds are always like sleeping on a cloud. I guess that's what you would expect while staying at the Four Seasons right? We have also have a 3 yr old & they were extremely accomodating with him as well.

Reviews.Title: “Feels Like Home (But Better)”
Reviews.Author: HRH2002
Reviews.Content: In typical fashion, the staff knew us by name even before we checked-in. The facility itself (while not the typical Four Seasons) looked brand-new, and made us feel that we were the first guests ever to stay in our room. This attention to detail and constant quest for perfection are what set the Four Seasons apart. The location also couldn't be better, with views of the Sound and proximity to the Market, Seattle Art Museum, Aquarium and downtown shopping. Finally, the gentleman at the concierge was incredibly helpful and made us reservations at a variety of the best restaurants in the city, then even followed-up to make sure we enjoyed them and took notes of which menu items we would recommend. This is the only place I would stay in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed.”
Reviews.Author: ARSeattle
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Seattle was nice but nothing special in comparison to other 5 star hotels I’ve stayed at… it just left sort of a flat feeling and I’d probably stay elsewhere next time we are in Seattle. It’s new and modern and the location right next to the Pike Place Market was terrific. We booked a standard room and were given a room with a partial view of Elliot Bay not sure if that is an upgrade or not but I wouldn't pay extra for a partial view. The room is what you’d expect in a business hotel but small in comparison to other hotels we’ve stayed at in Seattle: Fairmont Olympic and W. The bathroom was nice and larger at the Four Season than at the W and Fairmont. The TV in the bathroom mirror was different; though after the first morning we never turned it on. The Four Seasons has a nice heated outdoor lap pool and a hot tub overlooking Elliot Bay. The workout room was one of the nicest I’ve seen in a hotel.
