We had a partial water view and I agree the views are a bit industrial, but besides that minor comment we loved the hotel. We took advantage of their special offer for three nights and they were very accommodating to let us check in early and two hours late. When we checked in they gave us a coupon for $25 off the spa for each of us, so we used the spa, which is lovely and get a couples massage for no extra cost, although the view was very industrial from the massage room, but besides that we really enjoyed it. They offer a beautiful relaxation room with tea, snacks and water. We took a water plane to Victoria for a day trip and I would highly recommend that experience spectacular views and it is a beautiful city!

Reviews.Title: “Almost, but not quite perfect.”
Reviews.Author: jitterbugdance
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, I can't say that the FS Seattle exceeded my expectations. I was hoping they would, given it's a Four Seasons, but a couple of glitches in service surprised me and not in a good way. But please don't get me wrong, we still enjoyed our stay even with the little hiccups. Even before our stay, we emailed the hotel with our airline arrival and departure information so that we could get help booking airport transfers. It's a good thing I looked closely at the confirmation; the departure information was wrong, and it took several emails with their concierge staff to finally get all the correct information in writing. I did double-check my original email to them to make sure I hadn't given them wrong info, and sure enough, it was their error. To their credit, the limo service they made arrangements with was excellent. Another thing that surprised me was that after a full day out and about, we returned about 3pm to find that our room had not been serviced. Having worked in hotels, I realized that that's about the time that most of the housekeeping staff finishes for the day. We called housekeeping to inquire to see if someone would be coming to the room and to NOT have them come, since we were back in the room and wanting to rest. Well, I guess that's not what they do, since after talking with the attendant, someone was dispatched to our room to service it anyway, so we had to make a quick exit to the pool to let her do her thing. On the positive side, the staff are very welcoming and some do actually address you by name (room service) which is a nice touch. Pool attendants and porters were spot-on. We enjoyed the coffee, tea, and croissants in the lobby in the morning, too. The salted caramels from the chocolate shop in the lobby are so yummy. Location: a block from Pike Place Market was very convenient for us. Our room faced the SAM, and was surprisingly quiet, except one night when the duck tours bus/boat returned.

Reviews.Title: “What a GREAT time - the BEST all around!”
Reviews.Author: jtmcclay
Reviews.Content: My husband had a meeting in Seattle so we decided to make it a quick family get-away. This trip was for business and for pleasure combined. A friend from Seattle actually recommended the Four Seasons. The chain has been running some great deals lately; Stay longer package deals (stay 2 nights, get one in Houston/Seattle and several other cities), and we have been taking advantage! We stayed for 3 nights over a holiday weekend. So lucky to have PERFECT weather in Seattle and to take in all the great things the city has to offer. Walked and walked. Cant' think of a hotel with a better location to Pike's, etc! Very easy to get anywhere from the Four Seasons. For my taste, the decor was very comfortable, very lovely and soothing. Bathrooms were wonderfully big! They really treat families well, here - at all FS. Delivering pop corn and sodas and fresh made cookies upon check-in. Superb FS service: Late room service (although it did take a LONG time and one of my daughters feel asleep waiting for dinner to arrive) was very helpful to us. Housekeeping even located a lost earring for one of my daughters. The work out facility is really one of the better hotel fitness rooms I have used with the treadmills facing large windows with pool and water views. The pool deck was a nice surprise, got a little crowded on the warm, sunny days. Nice Spa and fire pit, also. The one downside I can think of is the staff could not seem to supply consistent information on whether food could be served pool side- it never was while we were there. The in house restaurant was OK - Four Seasons pricey, very pretty. Oh, and we got an 8am wake-up call one morning we did not request. Thank goodness it wasn't 5am! Staff was apologetic. All in all, the pluses far out weighed the minimal minuses in my opinion and I would not hesitate to stay at the FS if I return to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Four Seasons Standards”
Reviews.Author: SFTraveller101
Reviews.Content: I am a loyal Four Seasons customer and was very excited to have the chain come back to Seattle after many years of absence. Unfortunately, my first stay negated my excitement. The hotel is new and the rooms are reasonably nice and brand new, but not really up to Four Seasons standards. The furniture is light maple and the carpets are very bright. The entire place felt like it was built by high end Ikea. It doesn't look or feel luxurious. The other big problem is the location and the view. I paid extra for a waterview room, but it was dominated by a view of two big smokestacks and a construction site. Seattle has amazing water views but this hotel isn't situated in a spot that has them. In fact, it is still in a transitional neighborhood with a handful of peep shows and X rates theaters only a block away. The worst part of my stay, however, was my inability to take a normal shower. The water pressure in the shower was the lowest I've experienced in North America. I couldn't wash my hair and could barely get the soap off my body. Upon checkout I emailed the manager and he told me that the "water pressure in my room was consistent with the hotel standard." I don't know what that means but it is not connsistent with any other place and certainly not a Four Seasons. Seattle has great luxury hotel choices in Hotel 1000 and the new Pan Pacific. There is no reason at all to put up with the shortcomings of this Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Best major city hotel experience in the US.”
Reviews.Author: DiscerningTraveler88
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked in, this hotel (and its staff) blew us away. Each member of the staff greeted us by name -- including knowing our different last names and our daughter's first name. They kept track of where we went and asked my daughter if she enjoyed it. The recommendations provided for dining and activities were top shelf. The rooms are beautiful and definitely worth mentioning, but the true standout at this property is the staff. We have stayed in numerous Four Seasons properties throughout the world (including Paris) and this is hands down the top hotel for Service. This was our third vacation in Seattle and we will never stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “impeccable Service, a 5 Star+5 Diamond Kinda Place”
Reviews.Author: minicity
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in numerous hotels in downtown Seattle and have always appreciated being able to walk to nearby attractions. The Four Seasons is adjacent to Pike Place Market and it was a pleasure to sneak over for an early morning stroll through the Market prior to our conference. All aspects of our visit to the hotel were stellar. Great service, amenities and guestrooms. We would highly recommend staying here and think it is one of the highlights of our worldly travels. It is definitely would be a place to receive

Reviews.Title: “Service down to a Science”
Reviews.Author: Lady_World_Traveller
Reviews.Content: We had previously stayed at the Hotel Andra in November; we were disappointed with the rooms and were looking for a better stay at a similar pricepoint. I had vowed we would try the new Four Seasons which opened in November of 2008, on a return trip and got the chance when I was attending a photo seminar downtown. Overall, we were extremely impressed. Four Seasons Hotels have hospitality and service down to a science and this location is no different. From the time we arrived to the time we left, service was impeccable, warm and welcoming, with just the right level of familiarity. At check-in we were pleasantly surpised to be upgraded two levels; the hotel felt quite empty as it was a weekend, and I suspect this is the reason why. The lobby is very modern with a unique fireplace, and very comfortable seating. There is a small 24-hour business centre located to the left of the concierge desk, and there was free computer access on a few brand-new flat screen computers, with a color printer. A nice touch as usually you have to pay a high price for internet at these types of hotels. However, there is a charge for computer access in your room. The room was decorated in bland beige tones -- my only complaint about Four Seasons in general, but was extremely spacious and we had a view of the pool, plus a bit of the ocean. The bed was extremely comfortable, and the shower had great pressure. L'Occitaine amenities are in the bathroom, and the maids are generous if you want extras. The gym has brand-new state of the art equipment and was empty the weekend we were there; the pool is heated year round, and wasn't a bad temperature, considering it was about the mid 40's and raining. The hot tub was great, plus there was an outdoor propane fire pit, which was lovely on the chilly nights. Everything is well-maintained and spotless, plus there is always lemon or cucumber flavored water available at all times in the gym area. What impressed me the most about this hotel were the little touches available that made you feel pampered and probably costs the hotel relatively very little -- offers of free bottled water whenever you leave the hotel; in the mornings there are tiny croissants and apple pastries, plus coffee and tea in the lobby; guests are welcome to use the spa relaxation room to relax and read up-to-date magazines and partake in the "spa snacks" -- little cookies and candies plus nut and fruit snacks -- all for free. Art restaurant serves well-executed classics, nothing overtly trendy or fancy, which is nice for a change. Everything we ordered was excellent, you can't go wrong with anything on the menu. It is in the restaurant, though, they could improve service -- I told our server I was allergic to an item, and then they included it on my plate. We had breakfast in the restaurant two mornings in a row, and I was given the wrong breakfast each morning. My husband and I were the only ones in the restaurant. However, at Art, I can highly recommend the fresh baked individual apple pie, homemade ice creams/sorbets, and the breakfast TV tray if you want something filling but don't want to feel overstuffed. You will not be disappointed in your stay at this Four Seasons -- there are package deals out there on their website, as with everyone else, they are trying to make it in this economy. We have now found our hotel in Seattle and probably won't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & incredible staff helped to make our stay enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: LALA B
Reviews.Content: We reserved & checked into a beautiful harbor view room. It was very well planned... lots of storage, the chaise positioned perfectly for enjoying the view, and a spacious bathroom. Due to a small problem with the door, we were upgraded to a 1 room suite. It was amazing... an even better view, HUGE amount of space, beautiful fireplace, extra half bathroom and dining room. Very friendly and helpful staff, always greeting us whenever we saw them. We were pleasantly surprised to learn that the Pike Street Market was so close, and that we could access it through a small mall across the street from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: TravellingVLa
Reviews.Content: Amazing service from the second you drive up. Always opening doors, calling you by name, offered me an upgraded room, fast room service, excellent food at the restaurant, beautiful views from the room, great pool area (with firepit) and great gym. really excellent brand new hotel. right down in the heart of seattle - near pike's place - minutes to belltown, minutes to the freeway to redmond, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: Hippotours
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed here for 3 nights in a standard room. When we arrived at the hotel the door staff quickly jumped into action, taking our bags and holding doors opened. These are the same door staff who were there to hold the door open every time we left and returned to the hotel and who organised us transport whever needed. Check in was super efficient and we were on our way to our room within 2 minutes. The room itself was resonably large for a standard room and the bathroom was as big again. I loved the superbly comfortable bed and the very very deep soaking bath, big enough for 2! Also there were always replenished L'Occtaine bath products. I also loved how the maid service was very discreet and laid all of our toiletries out on towels by the sink. The view - It overlooked the city (Seattle Art Museum). You can however pay to upgrade to rooms overlooking the water if you wish. The hotel appeared very quiet so I imagine they can comfortable allow upgrades. They seemed to have no problem with us extending our check out time on the last day to 2.30pm. We had a walk around on our first day and found the pool and jacuzzi, both outside but I didn't try them with the cold Jan temperatures as they didn't feel hot enough for me! I imagine though that they will be lovely in the milder months. There is also a small business area close to reception with complimentary internet access, printer and all the usuals as well as an ATM. This was useful as there is a surcharge for use of the internet in the guest room so if you only need to quickly check email just pop into the business centre. We tried the bar for cocktails on Thurs and Fri nights after dinner elsewhere. On Thurs we were the only people in there and on Fri it was very busy so maybe this is a locals place to be on weekends, or maybe there were more tourists in town, who knows. The cocktails were lovely, if strong, in fact one of mine was so strong I couldn't drink it. The service generally was very attentive and we were often greeted by name in and around the reception area. The only thing I didn't like was that you could quite clearly hear the noise from the road below and we were on the 5th floor, however I am not sure how this could be avoided given the location of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ryzee
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Seattle is brand spanking new and was the reason we chose to drive down from Vancouver for a few days over the holidays. The hotel is perfectly located right next to the Pike Place Market with views over the water. The rooms are typical Four Seasons city hotel decor everything is perfectly in place but to be honest a wee bit boring. Common areas are lovely and the bar is a nice place to sip a cocktail and was quite buzzing. Staff were nice and attentive but not quite as polished as other properties that have been around a bit longer, to be expected given they had just opened. Would not hesitate to book here again next time we are in Seattle. One minor criticism we would have would be with housekeeping. One of the reasons we love the Four Seasons is the invisible housekeeping we have experienced. At other properties we have marveled at how every time we left the room it was miraculously made up when we returned and we never ever see a maid. At this location it seemed that we were always bumping into the housekeeping staff and the timing of the room refresh was always off, evening turndown service always came when we were in the room and we had to settle for grabbing a couple a fresh towels and a bar of soap from the maid through the doorway.
